title: PSScriptAnalyzer Configuration JSON Schema
description: WIP schema for PSScriptAnalyzerSettings.json using built-in settings.

IncludeRules.title: Rules To Include
IncludeRules.description: The rules to apply during ScriptAnalyzer invocation.

ExcludeRules.title: Rules To Exclude
ExcludeRules.description: The rules to exclude from ScriptAnalyzer invocation. Takes precedence over IncludeRules.

IncludeDefaultRules.title: Include Default Rules
IncludeDefaultRules.description: Specifies whether to include the default set of rules during ScriptAnalyzer invocation.

CustomRulePath.title: Custom Rule Path(s)
CustomRulePath.description: Specifies the file paths to custom rules to include during ScriptAnalyzer invocation. The paths should point either to a module's folder, which implicitly uses the module manifest, or to the module's psm1 script file. The module must export the custom rule functions using `Export-ModuleMember` for them to be available to PSScriptAnalyzer.

RecurseCustomRulePath.title: Recurse Custom Rule Path
RecurseCustomRulePath.description: Specifies whether to recursively search for custom rules in the specified CustomRulePath directories.

Severity.title: Rule Severity
Severity.description: Specifies the severity level of issues to report.

anyOf.description: Error severity level.
Warning severity level.
Information severity level.

RuleEnable.title: Enable
RuleEnable.description: Enable or disable the rule during ScriptAnalyzer invocation.

additionalProperties.title: Custom User-Defined Rule
additionalProperties.description: The name of the rule to configure.

^[\\w-]+.title: A Custom Rule Setting
^[\\w-]+.description: Configuration setting for the custom rule.

PSAlignAssignmentStatement.title: Align Assignment Statement
PSAlignAssignmentStatement.description: Line up assignment statements such that the assignment operator are aligned.

CheckHashtable.title: Check Hashtable
CheckHashtable.description: Enforce alignment of assignment statements in a hashtable and in a DSC Configuration. There is only one switch for hashtable and DSC configuration because the property value pairs in a DSC configuration are parsed as key-value pairs of a hashtable.

PSAvoidLongLines.title: Avoid Long Lines
PSAvoidLongLines.description: Line lengths should be less than the configured maximum

MaximumLineLength.title: Maximum Line Length
MaximumLineLength.description: Optional parameter to override the default maximum line length.

PSAvoidOverwritingBuiltInCmdlets.title: Avoid Overwriting Built-In Cmdlets
PSAvoidOverwritingBuiltInCmdlets.description: Do not overwrite the definition of a cmdlet that is included with PowerShell

PowerShellVersion.description: The parameter PowerShellVersion is a list of allowlists that ship with PSScriptAnalyzer.
PowerShellVersion.title: PowerShell Version

PSAvoidUsingCmdletAliases.title: Avoid Using Cmdlet Aliases
PSAvoidUsingCmdletAliases.description: An alias is an alternate name or nickname for a cmdlet or for a command element, such as a function, script, file, or executable file. An implicit alias is also the omission of the 'Get-' prefix for commands with this prefix. But when writing scripts that will potentially need to be maintained over time, either by the original author or another Windows PowerShell scripter, please consider using full cmdlet name instead of alias. Aliases can introduce these problems, readability, understandability and availability.

AllowList.title: Allow List
AllowList.description: A list of aliases to ignore when invoking the rule.

PSPlaceCloseBrace.title: Place Close Brace
PSPlaceCloseBrace.description: Close brace should be on a new line by itself.

NoEmptyLineBefore.title: No Empty Line Before
NoEmptyLineBefore.description: Create violation if there is an empty line before a close brace.

IgnoreOneLineBlock.title: Ignore One Line Block
IgnoreOneLineBlock.description: Indicates if closed brace pairs in a one line block should be ignored or not. For example, `$x = if ($true) { 'blah' } else { 'blah blah' }`, if the property is set to true then the rule doesn't fire a violation.

NewLineAfter.title: New Line After
NewLineAfter.description: Indicates if a new line should follow a close brace. If set to true a close brace should be followed by a new line.

PSPlaceOpenBrace.title: Place Open Brace
PSPlaceOpenBrace.description: Place open braces either on the same line as the preceding expression or on a new line.

IgnoreOneLineBlock.title: Ignore One Line Block
IgnoreOneLineBlock.description: Indicates if open braces in a one line block should be ignored or not. For example, `$x = if ($true) { 'blah' } else { 'blah blah' }`, if the property is set to true then the rule doesn't fire a violation.

NewLineAfter.title: New Line After
NewLineAfter.description: Enforce a new line character after an open brace. The default value is true.

OnSameLine.title: On Same Line
OnSameLine.description: Enforce open brace to be on the same line as that of its preceding keyword.

PSProvideCommentHelp.title: Provide Comment Help
PSProvideCommentHelp.description: Checks that all cmdlets have a help comment. This rule only checks existence. It does not check the content of the comment.

VSCodeSnippetCorrection.title: VS Code Snippet Correction
VSCodeSnippetCorrection.description: If enabled, returns comment help in VS Code snippet format.

BlockComment.title: Block Comment
BlockComment.description: If enabled, returns comment help in block comment style (`<#...#>`). Otherwise returns comment help in line comment style where each comment line starts with `#`.

ExportedOnly.title: Exported Only
ExportedOnly.description: If enabled, throw violation only on functions/cmdlets that are exported using the `Export-ModuleMember` cmdlet.

Placement.title: Comment Placement
Placement.description: Represents the position of comment help with respect to the function definition.

oneOf.title: before
oneOf.description: Means the help is placed before the function definition.

oneOf.title: begin
oneOf.description: Means the help is placed at the beginning of the function definition body.

oneOf.title: end
oneOf.description: Means the help is placed at the end of the function definition body.

PSReviewUnusedParameter.title: Review Unused Parameter
PSReviewUnusedParameter.description: Ensure all parameters are used within the same script, scriptblock, or function where they are declared.

CommandsToTraverse.title: Commands To Traverse
CommandsToTraverse.description: The CommandsToTraverse setting is a string array which allows you to add additional commands that accept scriptblocks that this rule should examine.

PSUseCompatibleCmdlets.title: Use Compatible Cmdlets
PSUseCompatibleCmdlets.description: Use cmdlets compatible with the given PowerShell version and edition and operating system

Compatibility.title: PowerShell Version Compatibility
Compatibility.description: This rule flags cmdlets that aren't available in a given Edition and Version of PowerShell on a given Operating System. It works by comparing a cmdlet against a set of allowlists which ship with PSScriptAnalyzer.

PSUseCompatibleCommands.title: Use Compatible Commands
PSUseCompatibleCommands.description: Use commands compatible with the given PowerShell version and operating system

IgnoreCommands.title: Ignore Commands
IgnoreCommands.description: Commands to ignore compatibility of in scripts.

ProfileDirPath.title: Profile Dir Path
ProfileDirPath.description: The location to search for profiles by name and use for union profile generation as an absolute path to the new profile dir.

TargetProfiles.title: Target Profiles
TargetProfiles.description: The list of PowerShell profiles to target.

PSUseCompatibleSyntax.title: Use Compatible Syntax
PSUseCompatibleSyntax.description: Use script syntax compatible with the given PowerShell versions

TargetVersions.title: Target Versions
TargetVersions.description: The PowerShell versions to check script syntax compatibility against.

PSUseCompatibleTypes.title: Use Compatible Types
PSUseCompatibleTypes.description: Use types compatible with the given PowerShell version and operating system

IgnoreTypes.title: Ignore Types
IgnoreTypes.description: Full names of types or type accelerators to ignore compatibility of in scripts.

ProfileDirPath.title: Profile Dir Path
ProfileDirPath.description: The location to search for profiles by name and use for union profile generation as an absolute path to the new profile dir.

TargetProfiles.title: Target Profiles
TargetProfiles.description: The list of PowerShell profiles to target as absolute paths to profile files or names of profiles in the profile directory.

PSUseConsistentIndentation.title: Use Consistent Indentation
PSUseConsistentIndentation.description: Each statement block should have a consistent indentation.

Kind.title: Kind
Kind.description: Represents the kind of indentation to be used. Possible values are: space, tab. If any invalid value is given, the property defaults to space.

PipelineIndentation.title: Pipeline Indentation
PipelineIndentation.description: Whether to increase indentation after a pipeline for multi-line statements.

oneOf.title: Increase Indentation For First Pipeline
oneOf.description: Increase indentation only for the first pipeline in a multi-line statement.

oneOf.title: Increase Indentation After Every Pipeline
oneOf.description: Indent more after the first pipeline and keep this indentation.

oneOf.title: None
oneOf.description: Do not change any existing pipeline indentation.

IndentationSize.title: Indentation Size
IndentationSize.description: Indentation size in the number of space characters.

PSUseConsistentWhitespace.title: Use Consistent Whitespace
PSUseConsistentWhitespace.description: Check for whitespace between keyword and open paren/curly, around assignment operator ('='), around arithmetic operators and after separators (',' and ';')

CheckOperator.title: Check Operator
CheckOperator.description: Checks if a binary or unary operator is surrounded on both sides by a space. E.g. '$x = 1' instead of '$x=1'.

IgnoreAssignmentOperatorInsideHashTable.title: Ignore Assignment Operator Inside Hash Table
IgnoreAssignmentOperatorInsideHashTable.description: When `CheckOperator` is set, ignore whitespace around assignment operators within multi-line hash tables. Set this option to use the AlignAssignmentStatement rule and still check whitespace around operators everywhere else.

CheckPipeForRedundantWhitespace.title: Check Pipe For Redundant Whitespace
CheckPipeForRedundantWhitespace.description: Checks if a pipe is surrounded by redundant whitespace (i.e. more than 1 whitespace). E.g. 'foo | bar' instead of 'foo    |    bar'.

CheckParameter.title: Check Parameter
CheckParameter.description: Checks if there is more than one space between parameters and values. E.g. `foo -bar $baz -bat` instead of `foo   -bar   $baz   -bat`. This eliminates redundant whitespace that was probably added unintentionally. The rule does not check for whitespace between parameter and value when the colon syntax `-ParameterName:$ParameterValue` is used as some users prefer either 0 or 1 whitespace in this case.

CheckInnerBrace.title: Check Inner Brace
CheckInnerBrace.description: Checks if there is a space after the opening brace and a space before the closing brace. E.g. `if ($true) { foo }` instead of `if ($true) {bar}`.

CheckOpenBrace.title: Check Open Brace
CheckOpenBrace.description: Checks if there is a space between a keyword and its corresponding open brace. E.g. `foo { }` instead of `foo{ }`. If an open brace is preceded by an open parenthesis, then no space is required.

CheckOpenParen.title: Check Open Parenthesis
CheckOpenParen.description: Checks if there is space between a keyword and its corresponding open parenthesis. E.g. `if ($true)` instead of `if($true)`.

CheckPipe.title: Check Pipe
CheckPipe.description: Checks if a pipe is surrounded on both sides by a space but ignores redundant whitespace. E.g. `foo | bar` instead of `foo|bar`.

CheckSeparator.title: Check Separator
CheckSeparator.description: Checks if a comma or a semicolon is followed by a space. E.g. `@(1, 2, 3)` or `@{a = 1; b = 2}` instead of `@(1,2,3)` or `@{a = 1;b = 2}`.

PSUseCorrectCasing.title: Use exact casing of cmdlet/function/parameter name
PSUseCorrectCasing.description: For better readability and consistency, use consistent casing.

CheckCommands.title: Check Commands
CheckCommands.description: If true, require the case of all operators to be lowercase.

CheckOperator.title: Check Operator
CheckOperator.description: If true, require the case of all commands to match their actual casing.

CheckKeyword.title: Check Keyword
CheckKeyword.description: If true, require the case of all keywords to be lowercase.

PSUseSingularNouns.title: Use Singular Nouns
PSUseSingularNouns.description: Cmdlet should use singular instead of plural nouns.

NounAllowList.title: Noun Allow List
NounAllowList.description: Commands to be excluded from this rule. 'Data' and 'Windows' are common false positives and are excluded by default.

anyOf.title: Custom Rule
anyOf.description: A custom PSScriptAnalyzer rule name. It should match the function name, e.g. 'Measure-MyCustomRule'.

anyOf.title: Align Assignment Statement
anyOf.description: Line up assignment statements such that the assignment operator are aligned.

anyOf.title: Avoid Assignment to Automatic Variable
anyOf.description: This automatic variables is built into PowerShell and readonly.

anyOf.title: Avoid Default Value for Mandatory Parameter
anyOf.description: Mandatory parameter should not be initialized with a default value in the param block because this value will be ignored.. To fix a violation of this rule, please avoid initializing a value for the mandatory parameter in the param block.

anyOf.title: Avoid Default Value Switch Parameter
anyOf.description: Switch parameter should not default to true.

anyOf.title: Avoid Exclaim Operator
anyOf.description: The negation operator ! should not be used for readability purposes. Use -not instead.

anyOf.title: Avoid Global Aliases
anyOf.description: Checks that global aliases are not used. Global aliases are strongly discouraged as they overwrite desired aliases with name conflicts.

anyOf.title: Avoid Global Functions
anyOf.description: Checks that global functions and aliases are not used. Global functions are strongly discouraged as they can cause errors across different systems.

anyOf.title: Avoid Global Variables
anyOf.description: Checks that global variables are not used. Global variables are strongly discouraged as they can cause errors across different systems.

anyOf.title: Avoid Invoking Empty Members
anyOf.description: Invoking non-constant members would cause potential bugs. Please double check the syntax to make sure members invoked are non-constant.

anyOf.title: Avoid Long Lines
anyOf.description: Line lengths should be less than the configured maximum

anyOf.title: Avoid Multiple Type Attributes
anyOf.description: Parameter should not have more than one type specifier.

anyOf.title: Avoid Null or Empty HelpMessage Attribute
anyOf.description: Setting the HelpMessage attribute to an empty string or null value causes PowerShell interpreter to throw an error while executing the corresponding function.

anyOf.title: Avoid Reserved Words as Function Names
anyOf.description: Avoid using reserved words as function names. Using reserved words as function names can cause errors or unexpected behavior in scripts.

anyOf.title: Avoid Overwriting Built-In Cmdlets
anyOf.description: Do not overwrite the definition of a cmdlet that is included with PowerShell

anyOf.title: Avoid Semicolons as Line Terminators
anyOf.description: Line should not end with a semicolon

anyOf.title: Avoid ShouldContinue Without Force
anyOf.description: Functions that use ShouldContinue should have a boolean force parameter to allow user to bypass it.

anyOf.title: Avoid Trailing Whitespace
anyOf.description: Each line should have no trailing whitespace.

anyOf.title: Avoid Using AllowUnencryptedAuthentication
anyOf.description: Avoid sending credentials and secrets over unencrypted connections.

anyOf.title: Avoid Using Broken Hash Algorithms
anyOf.description: Avoid using the broken algorithms MD5 or SHA-1.

anyOf.title: Avoid Using Cmdlet Aliases
anyOf.description: An alias is an alternate name or nickname for a cmdlet or for a command element, such as a function, script, file, or executable file. An implicit alias is also the omission of the 'Get-' prefix for commands with this prefix. But when writing scripts that will potentially need to be maintained over time, either by the original author or another Windows PowerShell scripter, please consider using full cmdlet name instead of alias. Aliases can introduce these problems, readability, understandability and availability.

anyOf.title: Avoid Using ComputerName Hardcoded
anyOf.description: The ComputerName parameter of a cmdlet should not be hardcoded as this will expose sensitive information about the system.

anyOf.title: Avoid Using ConvertTo-SecureString with PlainText
anyOf.description: Using ConvertTo-SecureString with plain text will expose secure information.

anyOf.title: Avoid Using Deprecated Manifest Fields
anyOf.description: "ModuleToProcess" is obsolete in the latest PowerShell version. Please update with the latest field "RootModule" in manifest files to avoid PowerShell version inconsistency.

anyOf.title: Avoid Using Double Quotes for Constant String
anyOf.description: Use single quotes if the string is constant.

anyOf.title: Avoid Using Empty Catch Block
anyOf.description: Empty catch blocks are considered poor design decisions because if an error occurs in the try block, this error is simply swallowed and not acted upon. While this does not inherently lead to bad things. It can and this should be avoided if possible. To fix a violation of this rule, using Write-Error or throw statements in catch blocks.

anyOf.title: Avoid Using Invoke-Expression
anyOf.description: The Invoke-Expression cmdlet evaluates or runs a specified string as a command and returns the results of the expression or command. It can be extraordinarily powerful so it is not that you want to never use it but you need to be very careful about using it.  In particular, you are probably on safe ground if the data only comes from the program itself.  If you include any data provided from the user - you need to protect yourself from Code Injection. To fix a violation of this rule, please remove Invoke-Expression from script and find other options instead.

anyOf.title: Avoid Using PlainText for Password
anyOf.description: Password parameters that take in plaintext will expose passwords and compromise the security of your system.

anyOf.title: Avoid Using Positional Parameters
anyOf.description: Readability and clarity should be the goal of any script we expect to maintain over time. When calling a command that takes parameters, where possible consider using name parameters as opposed to positional parameters. To fix a violation of this rule, please use named parameters instead of positional parameters when calling a command.

anyOf.title: Avoid Using Username and Password Parameters
anyOf.description: Functions should take in a Credential parameter of type PSCredential (with a Credential transformation attribute defined after it in PowerShell 4.0 or earlier) or set the Password parameter to type SecureString.

anyOf.title: Avoid Using WMI Cmdlet
anyOf.description: Deprecated. Starting in Windows PowerShell 3.0, these cmdlets have been superseded by CIM cmdlets.

anyOf.title: Avoid Using Write-Host
anyOf.description: Avoid using the Write-Host cmdlet. Instead, use Write-Output, Write-Verbose, or Write-Information. Because Write-Host is host-specific, its implementation might vary unpredictably. Also, prior to PowerShell 5.0, Write-Host did not write to a stream, so users cannot suppress it, capture its value, or redirect it.

anyOf.title: DSC Examples Present
anyOf.description: Every DSC resource module should contain folder "Examples" with sample configurations for every resource. Sample configurations should have resource name they are demonstrating in the title.

anyOf.title: DSC Tests Present
anyOf.description: Every DSC resource module should contain folder "Tests" with tests for every resource. Test scripts should have resource name they are testing in the file name.

anyOf.title: Return Correct Types for DSC Functions
anyOf.description: Set function in DSC class and Set-TargetResource in DSC resource must not return anything. Get function in DSC class must return an instance of the DSC class and Get-TargetResource function in DSC resource must return a hashtable. Test function in DSC class and Get-TargetResource function in DSC resource must return a boolean.

anyOf.title: Standard DSC Functions in Resource
anyOf.description: DSC Resource must implement Get, Set and Test-TargetResource functions. DSC Class must implement Get, Set and Test functions.

anyOf.title: Use Identical Mandatory Parameters for DSC
anyOf.description: The Get/Test/Set TargetResource functions of DSC resource must have the same mandatory parameters.

anyOf.title: Use Identical Parameters for DSC
anyOf.description: The Test and Set-TargetResource functions of DSC Resource must have the same parameters.

anyOf.title: Use Verbose Message in DSC Resource
anyOf.description: It is a best practice to emit informative, verbose messages in DSC resource functions. This helps in debugging issues when a DSC configuration is executed.

anyOf.title: Misleading Backtick
anyOf.description: Ending a line with an escaped whitespace character is misleading. A trailing backtick is usually used for line continuation. Users typically don't intend to end a line with escaped whitespace.

anyOf.title: Missing Module Manifest Field
anyOf.description: Some fields of the module manifest (such as ModuleVersion) are required.

anyOf.title: Place Close Brace
anyOf.description: Close brace should be on a new line by itself.

anyOf.title: Place Open Brace
anyOf.description: Place open braces either on the same line as the preceding expression or on a new line.

anyOf.title: Possible Incorrect Comparison with Null
anyOf.description: Checks that $null is on the left side of any equality comparisons (eq, ne, ceq, cne, ieq, ine). When there is an array on the left side of a null equality comparison, PowerShell will check for a $null IN the array rather than if the array is null. If the two sides of the comparison are switched this is fixed. Therefore, $null should always be on the left side of equality comparisons just in case.

anyOf.title: Possible Incorrect Usage of Assignment Operator
anyOf.description: '=' or '==' are not comparison operators in the PowerShell language and rarely needed inside conditional statements.

anyOf.title: Possible Incorrect Usage of Redirection Operator
anyOf.description: When switching between different languages it is easy to forget that '>' does not mean 'greater than' in PowerShell.

anyOf.title: Provide Comment Help
anyOf.description: Checks that all cmdlets have a help comment. This rule only checks existence. It does not check the content of the comment.

anyOf.title: Reserved Cmdlet Character
anyOf.description: Checks for reserved characters in cmdlet names. These characters usually cause a parsing error. Otherwise they will generally cause runtime errors.

anyOf.title: Reserved Parameters
anyOf.description: Checks for reserved parameters in function definitions. If these parameters are defined by the user, an error generally occurs.

anyOf.title: Review Unused Parameter
anyOf.description: Ensure all parameters are used within the same script, scriptblock, or function where they are declared.

anyOf.title: Should Process
anyOf.description: Checks that if the SupportsShouldProcess is present, the function calls ShouldProcess/ShouldContinue and vice versa. Scripts with one or the other but not both will generally run into an error or unexpected behavior.

anyOf.title: Use Approved Verbs
anyOf.description: Checks that all defined cmdlets use approved verbs. This is in line with PowerShell's best practices.

anyOf.title: Use BOM for Unicode Encoded File
anyOf.description: For a file encoded with a format other than ASCII, ensure BOM is present to ensure that any application consuming this file can interpret it correctly.

anyOf.title: Use Cmdlet Correctly
anyOf.description: Cmdlet should be called with the mandatory parameters.

anyOf.title: Use Compatible Cmdlets
anyOf.description: Use cmdlets compatible with the given PowerShell version and edition and operating system

anyOf.title: Use Compatible Commands
anyOf.description: Use commands compatible with the given PowerShell version and operating system

anyOf.title: Use Compatible Syntax
anyOf.description: Use script syntax compatible with the given PowerShell versions

anyOf.title: Use Compatible Types
anyOf.description: Use types compatible with the given PowerShell version and operating system

anyOf.title: Use Consistent Indentation
anyOf.description: Each statement block should have a consistent indentation.

anyOf.title: Use Consistent Whitespace
anyOf.description: Check for whitespace between keyword and open paren/curly, around assignment operator ('='), around arithmetic operators and after separators (',' and ';')

anyOf.title: Use Correct Casing
anyOf.description: For better readability and consistency, use consistent casing.

anyOf.title: Use Declared Variables More Than Assignments
anyOf.description: Ensure declared variables are used elsewhere in the script and not just during assignment.

anyOf.title: Use Literal Initializer for Hashtable
anyOf.description: Use literal initializer, @{}, for creating a hashtable as they are case-insensitive by default

anyOf.title: Use OutputType Correctly
anyOf.description: The return types of a cmdlet should be declared using the OutputType attribute.

anyOf.title: Use Process Block for Pipeline Command
anyOf.description: If a command parameter takes its value from the pipeline, the command must use a process block to bind the input objects from the pipeline to that parameter.

anyOf.title: Use PSCredential Type
anyOf.description: For PowerShell 4.0 and earlier, a parameter named Credential with type PSCredential must have a credential transformation attribute defined after the PSCredential type attribute.

anyOf.title: Use ShouldProcess for State Changing Functions
anyOf.description: Functions that have verbs like New, Start, Stop, Set, Reset, Restart that change system state should support 'ShouldProcess'.

anyOf.title: Use Singular Nouns
anyOf.description: Cmdlet should use singular instead of plural nouns.

anyOf.title: Use Supports ShouldProcess
anyOf.description: Commands typically provide Confirm and WhatIf parameters to give more control on its execution in an interactive environment. In PowerShell, a command can use a SupportsShouldProcess attribute to provide this capability. Hence, manual addition of these parameters to a command is discouraged. If a commands need Confirm and WhatIf parameters, then it should support ShouldProcess.

anyOf.title: Use ToExport Fields in Manifest
anyOf.description: In a module manifest, AliasesToExport, CmdletsToExport, FunctionsToExport and VariablesToExport fields should not use wildcards or $null in their entries. During module auto-discovery, if any of these entries are missing or $null or wildcard, PowerShell does some potentially expensive work to analyze the rest of the module.

anyOf.title: Use Using Scope Modifier in New Runspaces
anyOf.description: If a ScriptBlock is intended to be run as a new RunSpace, variables inside it should use 'Using:' scope modifier, or be initialized within the ScriptBlock.

anyOf.title: Use UTF8 Encoding for Help File
anyOf.description: PowerShell help file needs to use UTF8 Encoding.
